trustfund:
TF052689-PHRD-NICARAGUA: NICARAGUA
            POVERTY REDUCTION SUPPORT CREDIT

abstracts.cdata!:
The Poverty Reduction Support Credit
            (PRSC) approved in January 2004, provided financial
            assistance to Nicaragua to implement the country's
            Poverty Reduction Strategy. The Credit provided support in
            four areas: a) macroeconomic stability and protection of
            poverty expenditure; b) public institutions and governance;
            c) human capital of the poor and vulnerable populations;
            and, d) broad-based growth. Nicaragua made satisfactory
            progress in maintaining a macro-economic framework, and in
            carrying out the Strategy, and, there has also been
            satisfactory progress in respect of the key results
            envisaged in this Credit. Section II discusses the
            macroeconomic situation, Section III assesses progress with
            respect to the Poverty Reduction Strategy, and Section IV
            provides an evaluation of the completion of the nine
            specific actions. Given the delay in the completion of the
            registration does not adversely affect the implementation of
            the overall program supported by the PRSC series, or its
            components, it is proposed that a waiver be granted.
            Nevertheless, in order to reflect this delay, the amount of
            the disbursement would be reduced by SDR 3.5 million (as per
            the Borrower's cancellation of said amount pursuant to
            Section 6.01 of the relevant General Conditions). In
            consultation with the Ministry of Finance and Public Credit,
            FODIEN - Development Fund for the Electricity Industry - has
            been restructured through:1) the necessary modifications of
            FODIEN's legal structure based on an evaluation of such
            structure; 2) the entry into effect of rules and procedures
            for selection, implementation and monitoring of subprojects
            supported by FODIEN; 3) the establishment of funding,
            financing mechanisms and subsidy allocation criteria for
            subprojects; 4) the entry into effect of rules and
            procedures for FODIEN's management; and, 5) the
            adoption of a medium term financing plan of FODIEN,
            consistent with overall fiscal sustainability of the Borrower.
